segment.source: Windows®-based laptops must meet energy-efficiency regulatory requirements, such as the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Energy Star program.
segment.target: Windows®-based laptops must meet energy-efficiency regulatory requirements, such as the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Energy Star program.

segment.source: Furthermore, surveys have shown that longer battery life for laptops continues to be a leading request from consumers.
segment.target: Furthermore, surveys have shown that longer battery life for laptops continues to be a leading request from consumers.

segment.source: Hardware and software factors such as a low-capacity battery, a processor-intensive driver, or a poorly configured power setting can cause a significant reduction in battery life.
segment.target: Hardware and software factors such as a low-capacity battery, a processor-intensive driver, or a poorly configured power setting can cause a significant reduction in battery life.

segment.source: When you design your system, you should experiment with multiple configurations of each of these factors to find the best balance of battery life and performance.
segment.target: When you design your system, you should experiment with multiple configurations of each of these factors to find the best balance of battery life and performance.

segment.source: Windows Power Policy Settings
segment.target: Windows Power Policy Settings

segment.source: This section lists a few of the common configurable settings that can affect battery life.
segment.target: This section lists a few of the common configurable settings that can affect battery life.

segment.source: Test these and other settings to create an optimal power plan for your system.
segment.target: Test these and other settings to create an optimal power plan for your system.

segment.source: Settings can be specific to whether the computer is plugged in (AC) or on battery power (DC).
segment.target: Settings can be specific to whether the computer is plugged in (AC) or on battery power (DC).

segment.source: You can configure the following settings:
segment.target: You can configure the following settings:

segment.source: Display brightness
segment.target: Display brightness

segment.source: The most effective way to reduce the power consumption on a mobile computer when the display is in use is to reduce the display brightness.
segment.target: The most effective way to reduce the power consumption on a mobile computer when the display is in use is to reduce the display brightness.

segment.source: The attached display is the largest power consumer.
segment.target: The attached display is the largest power consumer.

segment.source: The display uses up to 40 percent of the overall system power consumption.
segment.target: The display uses up to 40 percent of the overall system power consumption.

segment.source: By default, Windows significantly reduces the display brightness when a mobile computer is on battery power.
segment.target: By default, Windows significantly reduces the display brightness when a mobile computer is on battery power.

segment.source: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default display brightness setting lower to increase battery life, or higher to make the display easier to read.
segment.target: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default display brightness setting lower to increase battery life, or higher to make the display easier to read.

segment.source: Display timeout
segment.target: Display timeout

segment.source: Mobile PC battery life can be significantly extended by using a short display idle timeout.
segment.target: Mobile PC battery life can be significantly extended by using a short display idle timeout.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Display dimming: Mobile computers that run Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 will dim the display 15 seconds before the Display timeout.
segment.target: Display dimming: Mobile computers that run Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 will dim the display 15 seconds before the Display timeout.

segment.source: This value is no longer configurable.
segment.target: This value is no longer configurable.

segment.source: Hard disk timeout
segment.target: Hard disk timeout

segment.source: Although the hard disk drive is not the primary power consumer in the typical mobile computer, you may be able to save power by increasing the hard drive timeout.
segment.target: Although the hard disk drive is not the primary power consumer in the typical mobile computer, you may be able to save power by increasing the hard drive timeout.

segment.source: When the hard drive is idle for a period of time, the hard drive's motor stops.
segment.target: When the hard drive is idle for a period of time, the hard drive's motor stops.

segment.source: The next time that the computer needs to access the hard drive, the system response may be slow while the hard drive begins to spin again.
segment.target: The next time that the computer needs to access the hard drive, the system response may be slow while the hard drive begins to spin again.

segment.source: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default hard disk timeout lower to increase battery life, or higher to increase the availability of the hard disk.
segment.target: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default hard disk timeout lower to increase battery life, or higher to increase the availability of the hard disk.

segment.source: Sleep mode
segment.target: Sleep mode

segment.source: By default, if the processor is idle, and the end user is not using the computer, Windows enters low-power sleep mode or hibernate mode.
segment.target: By default, if the processor is idle, and the end user is not using the computer, Windows enters low-power sleep mode or hibernate mode.

segment.source: The next time that the computer needs processor power, system response may be slow while the processor recovers.
segment.target: The next time that the computer needs processor power, system response may be slow while the processor recovers.

segment.source: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default sleep timer lower to increase battery life, or higher to increase the availability of the processor.
segment.target: Depending on your hardware and the needs of your users, you can adjust the default sleep timer lower to increase battery life, or higher to increase the availability of the processor.

segment.source: Wireless adapter power-save modes
segment.target: Wireless adapter power-save modes

segment.source: By default, Windows configures the 802.11 power-save mode to Maximum Performance for both AC and battery power.
segment.target: By default, Windows configures the 802.11 power-save mode to Maximum Performance for both AC and battery power.

segment.source: This configuration keeps the wireless adapter active, even when data is not being transferred.
segment.target: This configuration keeps the wireless adapter active, even when data is not being transferred.

segment.source: This alleviates compatibility problems between some wireless adapters and access points that are not compatible with 802.11 power-save modes.
segment.target: This alleviates compatibility problems between some wireless adapters and access points that are not compatible with 802.11 power-save modes.

segment.source: If you create custom power policies to save more power and help extend battery life, consult with the manufacturer of the wireless adapter about the effects of changing the power policy value to Maximum Power Saving or Medium Power Saving.
segment.target: If you create custom power policies to save more power and help extend battery life, consult with the manufacturer of the wireless adapter about the effects of changing the power policy value to Maximum Power Saving or Medium Power Saving.

segment.source: You can manually modify the power settings for each built-in power configuration.
segment.target: You can manually modify the power settings for each built-in power configuration.

segment.target: To learn more about these settings and other common configurable power settings, see Mobile Battery Life Solutions: A Guide for Mobile Platform Professionals and Power Policy Configuration and Deployment in Windows.
